data.title: Cajun Cooking Done Right
data.text: The sign on the door says "Shackie's Seafood and Oyster Bar" but the ticket says "Seafood Shack." Either way, this place has a dual identity. If you look at the menu on the wall, it announces all the varieties of fresh oysters they have on hand for the day. So, I suppose, if I were in the mood for oysters, that would be a good place to start. But, all the  reviews I read raved about their cajun seafood buckets. Unfortunately, in my party, no one wanted to go for the bucket and I needed three takers to join me. So, I went for a pound of fresh crawfish. They have all types of sauces you can get and all levels of "heat" you can get. I opted for the Shackie sauce (basically everything) and at a medium level of heat. I WAS NOT DISSAPOINTED! Thank God Kevin, our waiter suggested that I get a side of rice to pour the drippings from my crawfish over. That was the best way not to waste a truly great taste experience. One other in my party ordered the Mahi Mahi, which looked about average to me. But, another ordered the garlic noodles with everything and that also was awesome! This is one of those places where you just say to yourself when leaving that you MUST come back and dive deeper into their menu as there are clearly some treasures well worth exploring.

data.title: Fresh and nice dinner
data.text: Me and friends come order some crawfish, clam and shrimps. Quite nice! I don't think it's the best in town, but they are all pretty fresh and tasty. Service is friendly and attentive. Overall we had a good time dining here

data.title: Best Cajun Seafood Ever!
data.text: This is my number one feel good eatery. I get the cajun spiced lobster, crab and shrimp pot. The garlic fries are awesome. If you like garlic you will love this place. Come early as they always get packed.

data.title: Fresh & Tasty
data.text:
We decided to try this restaurant from reviews we read online, and were not disappointed. It doesn't look like much from the outside, but they offer seafood by the pound- pick your own seasoning, and an impressive oyster menu.
I got a pound of shrimp with garlic butter, my husband got the noodles with "the works" which included a generous amount of shrimp, scallops and clams, and we split the garlic fries. SO MUCH FLAVOR! I was planning to order dessert, but they brought us the bill instead of asking, probably wanted to close early. Other than that, great service and food (bibs provided).

data.title: Whimsical in Westminster
data.text:
Seafood Shack has the same stuff as many of the Cajun Viet places w/ "Crab" in the name.  But the menu includes oysters ($2/each), clam chowder, wings, and garlic noodles.  SS is in on Westminster Blvd, in between Goldenwest & Beach in Westminster.  

For three of us, we ordered fries ($4); 1 lb of shrimp w/ shack sauce ($10 - MP); calamari ($9); clam chowder ($5 - sorry no pic); 6 fish sauce wings ($6); and garlic noodles w/ sausage, clams & shrimp ($13).  The first thing I noticed about SS is the prices are very reasonable.

The fries were very good.  The portion was large for the price, they came out piping hot and were nicely seasoned:  4 Stars.  Secondly, the shrimp were also better than average.  They were plump & juicy, and the shack sauce had good flavor w/o overpowering the shrimp:  4 Stars.  Unfortunately, the calamari was just OK.  They were all rings (and of uniform size), so they were prolly frozen.  I like tentacles!:  3 Stars.  On the other hand, the clam chowder was really good.  It was chocked full of clams, and had a nice flavor to it.  The only room for improvement was the broth could have been thicker:  4 Stars.  I heard the wings were good, but the fish sauce ones were very average.  You could taste the fish sauce, but it didn't seem like the wings were seasoned.  Nonetheless, they were crispy:  3 Stars.  Lastly, the noodles were very garlicky, and very tasty.  Despite different cooking times, the seafood was moist & the sausage was tender.  This dish was a good way to end the meal:  4 Stars.

The service was really good.  The waitress was very friendly as was the remainder of the staff.  In addition, the food came out quickly:  4 Stars.  Lastly, the motif is a bit whimsical, with faux nets, life preservers and fishing rods:  3 Stars.

I definitely want to return and try the oysters, and more Cajun Viet seafood.  I had recently been to Kicking Crab, and I wasn't in the mood for more this evening.  Plus, they have Longboard beer from Hawaii!!!

data.title: If you want at great meal at the right price go to Seafood Shack!
data.text: The freshest seafood, head and shoulders above the rest, hands down, the for real smokin' white hot deal!  Find another other, I double-dog dare you.  You'll be wasting your money.

data.title: Dinner & a pet
data.text:
We found this restaurant by looking for a place via "Iwant" from our i phone while visiting the area from Las Vegas.  Their specialty is crawfish and they do it exceptionally.  We have eaten at the "Hot N Juicy" (as featured in man v food) in Vegas which is what I compare this facility to, and seafood shack is hands down the best crawfish I have ever had & their spices are spot on!!  
     The owner is very pleasant & personable ensuring we were happy and all our needs were taken care of, the staff is equally as nice & pleasant.  Before we left the owner gave my son a live crawfish to take home, my son was thoroughly amazed and appreciative.
     I highly recommend this restaurant

data.title: "Fresh" shellfish
data.text: A wholesaler in back, a restaurant in front guarantees that the shellfish are always fresh at this small mom-and-pop operation.  The only "fish" is tilapia, but there is plenty of choice in the clams, crabs, oysters, shrimp, and snails, served up, if you wish, in a spicy garlic and chili strewn sauce. Crisp French bread is a $1 extra but matches the food well.  Be sure to order their refreshing house cold "tea."
